translated: The group cannot easily determine the implied commission rate on leases, so it uses the additional borrowing rate to measure lease obligations..  The additional borrowing rate represents the commission rate at which a group has to pay to borrow funds to acquire an asset of a value similar to that of a right-of-use in a similar economic environment, over a similar period and with a similar security..  Thus, the additional borrowing rate reflects what the group has to pay, which requires an estimate when observable rates are not available – such as for dependents who do not make financing transactions – or when they have to be adjusted to reflect the severity of the lease..
